text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Extension NHS communication preferences for a resource
extension Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
extension 1..1Languages which may be used for communication
url "language"
valueCodeableConcept 1..CodeableConceptLanguages which may be used for communication
Binding: Care Connect Human Language (required)
extension ..1Language preference indicator
url "preferred"
valueBoolean 1..booleanIndicates whether or not this language is preferred (over other languages up a certain level)
extension Mode of communication for the selected language
url "modeOfCommunication"
valueCodeableConcept 1..CodeableConceptA valueset to describe the mode the patient can communicate in, representing the method of expression of the language.
Binding: Care Connect Language Ability Mode (required)
extension ..1The level of proficiency in communicating a language
url "communicationProficiency"
valueCodeableConcept 1..CodeableConceptA valueset to describe the level of proficiency in communicating a language
Binding: Care Connect Language Ability Proficiency (required)
extension ..1Interpreter preference indicator
url "interpreterRequired"
valueBoolean 1..booleanIndicates whether an interpreter is required for communication purposes
url "https://fhir.hl7.org.uk/STU3/StructureDefinition/Extension-CareConnect-NHSCommunication-1"
value[x] ..0

Documentation for this format

name: Extension-CareConnect-NHSCommunication-1
description: This extension is constrained to support the communication preferences for a resource in the NHS.

element.short: NHS communication preferences for a resource
element.definition: Communication preferences including a list of Languages which may be used for communication

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: xml:id (or equivalent in JSON)
element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.short: Extension
element.definition: An Extension

Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.
